fields.headline: France spring surprise
fields.bodyText: Marc Lièvremont, a 38-year-old former Test flanker, is France's new coach. He succeeds Bernard Laporte, who joined the French government on Monday as a junior minister for sport. Lièvremont won 23 caps between 1995 and 1999 and as a coach guided Dax back to the French first division. He will be assisted by the former France wing Emile Ntamack and Didier Retière, joint coaches of the France Under-21 side that won the 2006 world title. "A page has just been turned with the World Cup and we want to write a new one with these three men," said Bernard Lapasset, the president of the French federation. Lièvremont, who has signed a four-year deal, will work with Jo Maso, the current team manager. Other coaches were considered, among them Sale's Philippe Saint-André, Stade Français' Fabien Galthié and Toulouse's Guy Novès.
